name: dryness
content:
dryness noun [U]
(NOT BEING WET)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of having little water or other liquid : The amount you sweat can be affected by the dryness of the atmosphere. The meat was juicy with no hint of dryness.
the fact or result of not having much rain: Southern Florida experienced unusual April dryness this year. Healthy plants can better withstand stress from pests, heat and dryness.
(of a part of the body) the state of not having enough of the natural oils or liquid that make it soft, smooth, and healthy: Regular application of the lotion will help prevent dryness of the skin.
More examplesFewer examplesAir conditioning helps reduce excessive humidity. As for dryness, room humidifiers can help.The pellets were still largely intact. This apparently arose because of the dryness of the site. Even cactuses are thirsty and fish can't spawn as severe dryness hits the US.The symptoms of dry eye include dryness, blurred vision, itching, sensitivity to light and irritation.These products also relieve other symptoms of vaginal dryness, like itching and irritation.

dryness noun [U]
(BEING BORING)
the fact of not being interesting : I myself enjoy the dryness of statistics. The dryness of the speech had caused Joseph's attention to wander.
More examplesFewer examplesLawyers tend to be overly technical, dry, and dull, and I hope that I can avoid over-technicality, dryness, and dullness.Artists often express antipathy towards the supposed dryness of the scientific world view.

dryness noun [U]
